content.question: An aqueous solution contains small but equal concentrations of both chloroacetic and fluoroacetic acids. Which statement comparing the percent ionizations of the two acids in the solution is true?

choices.label: The percent ionization of chloroacetic acid is greater than that of fluoroacetic acid.
The percent ionization of chloroacetic acid is less than that of fluoroacetic acid.
The percent ionizations cannot be compared without knowing the concentrations of the two acids.
The percent ionizations cannot be compared without knowing the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solution.

content.answer: The percent ionization of chloroacetic acid is less than that of fluoroacetic acid.
